ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I received a strong foundation in organometallic chemistry and its various applications. My mechanistic understanding greatly improved.

I learned applications of organometallic fundamentals within the context of hydrogenation, C-H activation, olefin polymerization and metathesis, cross coupling, and various industrial processes. There were a lot of good examples of famous reactions and investigations into their mechanisms, and how various successful and failed experimentation led to insight.
I learned about many processes using organometallic catalysts

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The course is very well designed and Nilay makes himself available whenever students need him. However, students would have benefited from a teaching assistant.

This was a great course and helped me apply things I had learned in 403 to applications are actually relevant, which was super satisfying. Super well laid out with notes and course material readily available. PSets were fair, but sometimes they kinda had nothing to do with what we were learning in class which was kind of confusing. Just go to office hours if you run into anything like that. The term paper was actually super cool to write and I feel that I gained knowledge and appreciation for my topic, which I barely thought about before. The final exam is also not too bad! Overall a course that gives you so much and isn't going to break your back with work.

I was grateful to take a class that talked in detail about discoveries that have successfully been implemented in industry, as I felt it gave me some insight into chemistry "from the other side" so to speak that I had not seen in other electives. I do not feel there were any weaknesses that would not be remedied by an in-person experience.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Breakout rooms were helpful but often times we were confused and couldnt get to a good understanding of the problem.
I liked that the lectures were recorded and uploaded so we could review them later. I also liked that the professor made himself readily available for any questions.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: YES!!! You learn so much and start learning more recent advancements in chemistry as opposed to the famous reactions that you learn in orgo that have been taught forever. The course material is presented very well and the assessments (3 psets, term paper, and midterm) are actually engaging and interesting to complete. It's not an easy class by any means, but it's not impossible and won't suck the life out of you like pchem lab. I loved taking this class and highly recommend it to anyone interested in inorganic chemistry or organic synthesis, as it is useful to understand the reactions you learn in these class for your syntheses.
Yes, good for all chemistry majors, especially those interested in organometallics or organic chemistry

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Recorded lecture and office hours were also provided. The recordings were placed on the web in a timely manner and the office hours were great for getting a better understanding of the material.
